intro: Commidendrum rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leafed milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are thick and rounded, adapted to store water, which is a common trait among plants in arid environments. Commidendrum rotundifolium is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
